SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.json.mapping.serialization

Interface JSONMapper

All Superinterfaces:
Mapper, ReadingMapper<JSONMapper,Bindable>
public interface JSONMapper extends ReadingMapper<JSONMapper,Bindable>
Interface for mapping Plain Old Java Objects (POJOs) to JSONObject instances.

This interface defines the contract for converting Java objects into their JSON representation. It provides mechanisms to register custom type handlers that dictate how specific types are serialized. Additionally, it supports configuring naming conventions for JSON field names through a NameConverter.

Implementations of this interface are responsible for handling the serialization process, ensuring that Java objects are accurately and efficiently transformed into JSON format. This includes managing primitive types, complex objects, collections, and handling special cases such as circular references.

Key Features:

  • Conversion of Java objects to JSONObject.
  • Conversion of Java arrays and collections to JSONArray.
  • Support for custom type handlers via TypeAdapter registration.
  • Configurable naming strategies for JSON field names using NameConverter.
  • Handling of complex and nested Java objects during serialization.
  • Management of serialization context, including circular reference handling.

Example Usage:


 // Instantiate a JSONMapper implementation with default naming strategy
 JSONMapper mapper = JSONMapper.newMapper();

 // Example POJO
 MyClass myObject = new MyClass(1337, "Example");

 // Serialize POJO to JSONObject
 JSONObject jsonObject = mapper.toJSONObject(myObject, MappingContext.getDefault());
 System.out.println(jsonObject.toJSONString());

 // Example list of POJOs
 List<MyClass> list = Arrays.asList(
     new MyClass(1, "First"),
     new MyClass(2, "Second")
 );

 // Serialize list to JSONArray
 JSONArray jsonArray = mapper.toJSONArray(list, MappingContext.getDefault());
 System.out.println(jsonArray.toJSONString());

Exception Handling:

  • MappingException: Thrown when an error occurs during the serialization process, such as type mismatches, inaccessible fields, or issues with custom type handlers.
  • RuntimeException: Thrown for unexpected, critical errors that do not fall under MappingException. These typically include unchecked exceptions that arise from unforeseen issues.

Implementers should ensure that MappingException is thrown for known, recoverable issues related to serialization, while reserving RuntimeException for unforeseen, critical errors.

See Also:

    • newMapper

      static JSONMapper newMapper(NameConverter nameConverter)
      Creates a new JSONMapper instance with a specified naming converter.
      Parameters:
      nameConverter - the naming strategy to apply to fields
      Returns:
      a new JSONMapper instance configured with the provided naming converter

    • toJSONObject

      @NotNull default @NotNull JSONObject toJSONObject(@NotNull @NotNull Object object)
      Converts a Plain Old Java Object (POJO) to a JSONObject using the default MappingContext.

      This method initiates the serialization process, transforming the given Java object into its JSON representation using the default mapping context, which may include default settings for handling circular references and other serialization behaviors.

      Parameters:
      object - the POJO to be serialized
      Returns:
      a JSONObject representing the serialized form of the given POJO
      Throws:
      MappingException - if an error occurs during serialization
      NullPointerException - if object is null

    • toJSONObject

      @NotNull @NotNull JSONObject toJSONObject(@NotNull @NotNull Object object, @NotNull @NotNull MappingContext context)
      Converts a Plain Old Java Object (POJO) to a JSONObject.

      This method initiates the serialization process, transforming the given Java object into its JSON representation. It utilizes the registered TypeAdapters and the specified MappingContext to manage serialization rules and handle special cases such as circular references.

      Parameters:
      object - the POJO to be serialized
      context - the MappingContext that provides context information for the serialization process, such as handling circular references and custom serialization behaviors
      Returns:
      a JSONObject representing the serialized form of the given POJO
      Throws:
      MappingException - if serialization fails due to type mismatches, inaccessible fields, or other mapping issues
      NullPointerException - if object or context is null

    • toJSONArray

      @NotNull @NotNull JSONArray toJSONArray(@NotNull @NotNull Object[] array, @NotNull @NotNull MappingContext context)
      Converts an array of objects to a JSONArray.

      This method serializes each element of the provided array into its JSON representation and aggregates them into a JSONArray. The specified MappingContext governs the serialization behavior, including handling of nested objects and circular references.

      Parameters:
      array - the array of objects to be serialized
      context - the MappingContext that provides context information for the serialization process, such as handling circular references and custom serialization behaviors
      Returns:
      a JSONArray representing the serialized form of the given array of objects
      Throws:
      MappingException - if serialization fails due to type mismatches, inaccessible fields, or other mapping issues
      NullPointerException - if array or context is null

    • toJSONArray

      @NotNull @NotNull JSONArray toJSONArray(@NotNull @NotNull Iterable<?> iterable, @NotNull @NotNull MappingContext context)
      Converts an Iterable of objects to a JSONArray.

      This method serializes each element of the provided Iterable into its JSON representation and aggregates them into a JSONArray. The specified MappingContext governs the serialization behavior, including handling of nested objects and circular references.

      Parameters:
      iterable - the Iterable of objects to be serialized
      context - the MappingContext that provides context information for the serialization process, such as handling circular references and custom serialization behaviors
      Returns:
      a JSONArray representing the serialized form of the given Iterable of objects
      Throws:
      MappingException - if serialization fails due to type mismatches, inaccessible fields, or other mapping issues
      NullPointerException - if iterable or context is null
